greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integers k such that cototient(k) = n.
comment: Note that a(0) is also well-defined to be 1 because the only solution to x - phi(x) = 0 is x = 1. - _Jianing Song_, Dec 25 2018
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
mathematica: Table[Count[Range[n^2], k_ /; k - EulerPhi@ k == n], {n, 2, 105}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 17 2017 *)
program: (PARI) first(n)=my(v=vector(n),t); forcomposite(k=4,n^2, t=k-eulerphi(k); if(t<=n, v[t]++)); v[2..n] \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 17 2017
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 13 2001
ext: Name edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 17 2017
